intro: Lappula redowskii, commonly known as redowskii's lappula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
